comments.body: this is a bad pattern for a module, change to detect dict or string (assume path)
Got it, thanks. I will update modules that are using this.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +45,49 @@    variables:
      description:
        - Inventory variables. Use '@' to get from file.
      required: False
      default: null

comments.body: @ryanpetrello do you think there may be any problems with past versions by passing kind & host_filter? I would say probably not, as long as the tower-cli version was up-to-date, it may send an extra field, but that would be ignored by the API.

I just tested a Tower 3.1.x install to be sure, and it seems fine to me:

```shell
curl -sk "https://admin:pass@some-tower-3.1.6.amazonaws.com/api/v2/inventories/?kind=smart&host_filter=foo" | python -m json.tool
{
    "count": 0,
    "next": null,
    "previous": null,
    "results": []
}
```

                json_output['id'] = result['id']
